meanings.definition: To give too much encouragement or support to someone.
meanings.sent1: She kept overencouraging her friend, which made them feel pressured.
meanings.sent2: The coach was overencouraging the team, pushing them to their limits.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's overencouraging behavior led to the students feeling overwhelmed.
meanings.sent4: His overencouraging attitude was like a never-ending cheerleading routine.
meanings.sent5: The constant overencouraging created a suffocating atmosphere in the room.

meanings.sent1: Her overencouraging words lifted his spirits instantly.
meanings.sent2: The overencouraging parent always praised their child, no matter what.
meanings.sent3: The overencouraging tone of the advertisement made it hard to believe.
meanings.sent4: The overencouraging atmosphere in the office made everyone feel motivated.
meanings.sent5: The overencouraging feedback gave her the confidence to pursue her dreams.
